byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Democratic party officials say FBI has broadened its investigation into cyberattack targeting Democratic party members and organizations and has informed long list of officials that Russians may have breached their personal email accounts; organizations like Democratic Governors' Assn, in addition to Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee and Democratic National Committee, may have been affected, and revelations stemming from attack may become public before presidential election.

headline.print_headline: Wider Damage Seen in Hack of Democrats
headline.main: Hack of Democrats’ Accounts Was Wider Than Believed, Officials Say

snippet: A Russian cyberattack is now thought to have breached the private email accounts of more than 100 party officials and groups....
lead_paragraph: A Russian cyberattack is now thought to have breached the private email accounts of more than 100 party officials and groups.
